definition: lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face

sentences.english: Comes face to face with an adversary the brave victory, now judges true brave to be also too early.
sentences.chinese: 狹路相逢勇者勝，現在來判斷真正的勇者還爲時過早。

sentences.english: It opens on the narrow path toward racial fascism.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的定義，開闢了通向種族法西斯主義的狹路。

sentences.english: The Opposition speaker accused the British Government of leading the country up the garden path on the question of civil defence.
sentences.chinese: 反對黨發言人指責英國政府把國家領上了一條狹路。

sentences.english: A part of little width, as a pass through mountains.
sentences.chinese: 狹路，隘路狹窄部分，如穿山小徑。

sentences.english: They drove down a narrow track that branched off from the main road.
sentences.chinese: 他們駛入一條從幹道分叉的小狹路。

sentences.english: In a darkened hangar, the two confronted Dooku.
sentences.chinese: 在一個光線陰暗的機庫中，兩人與杜庫狹路相逢。

definition: the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
to cut off/to interrupt/to prevent access
Kaiyuan county level city in Honghe Hani and Yi autonomous prefecture, Yunnan
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
border fort, esp. defending narrow valley
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
in large numbers/in force/lit. clouds bubbling up
see 清風明月|清风明月[qing1 feng1 ming2 yue4]
